objects.description:
Verify that all strings are translated into the locale you are testing. If you find an untranslated string, look at the same string in a pseudolocale (preferably Accented English). If the string appears in normal English, it is hard-coded and not
localizable. File a bug under the "Firefox OS" component and add the keyword "l12y". If the string appears in a pseudolocale, then the localizer hasn't got to it yet. Please don't file a bug.

Important: To disable screen reader swipe left (or right) on ""Stop Screen Reader"" page with one finger (from middle of screen, slide to the left/right in one smooth motion) until right red Stop button is highlighted. When hightlighted, quick double-tap on stop button.

*Other Accessibility cases: 183, 205, 223, 275, 345, 379, 591"
objects.name: The string "Stop Screen Reader? " is translated properly without truncation

steps.instruction: Tap on 'Settings' from the home screen and tap 'Device Information'
Tap 'More Information' and enable 'Developer Menu' at the bottom
Tap the back 'arrow' icon in the top left of the screen until you are back to the 'Settings' screen
Tap 'Developer' and enable 'Show accessibility settings'
Tap the back 'arrow' icon in the top left of the screen until you are back to the 'Settings' screen and then tap 'Accessibility'
Enable Screen Reader (the toggle at the top) and tap 'Start' (the red button on the right)
Long press the Screen Reader toggle until the area is highlighted by a yellow rectangle
Quickly double-tap Screen Reader toggle

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

localizable. File a bug under the "Firefox OS" component and add the keyword "l12y". If the string appears in a pseudolocale, then the localizer hasn't got to it yet. Please don't file a bug.

Prerequisite: Have at least 1 contact in the contacts app

localizable. File a bug under the "Firefox OS" component and add the keyword "l12y". If the string appears in a pseudolocale, then the localizer hasn't got to it yet. Please don't file a bug.

Prerequisite: Have a SIM card in the device

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.description:
As a user, I want to be able to sign up for a firefox account during the first run experience if I do not already have one. (refined from 897600)

Note: Use http://10minutemail.com/10MinuteMail/index.html to create temporary email address for testing purpose
objects.name: Sign up / Sign in on First Run

steps.expected:
Per Bug 1010598, COPPA dialog should not be present

Verify when user input is completed, screen shows 'Confirm your account ' page with 'Done' button.

Terms of service and Privacy Notice texts should match from following URL:

https://github.com/mozilla/legal-docs/tree/master/firefox_cloud_services_ToS
https://github.com/mozilla/legal-docs/tree/master/firefox_cloud_services_PrivacyNotice

and free from spelling, punctuation and grammatical mistakes
steps.instruction:
Upon flashing, follow FTE.  When Firefox Account setup page is shown, press 'Create Account or Sign in'.  Enter email address, year of birth, and password

View Terms of service and Privacy Notice text presented in the email address prompt pageby clicking the link for each of them

steps.expected: Verify the confirmation email has been sent, with the 'Verify' button shown
steps.instruction: Open the email account specified in step 1

steps.expected: In Settings -> Firefox accounts, verify the account has been now created, completed verification.  Verify it shows the same email address from step 1.
steps.instruction: Click the Verify button from the email sent to the designated email address in step 1

steps.expected: Verify the screen goes back to the main settings workflow.  If user already reached the end of the account creation process when X was pressed, verify the user can see the message that account has been associated with the phone, and 'Create Account or Sign in' button is greyed out while 'back' and 'next' are active
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - Repeat step 1, and at any time, click X on top left corner

steps.expected: Verify the error message is shown describing that the phone cannot connect to the firefox account server,  as a modal dialog
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - Repeat step 1, and at any time, manually drop the connection (i.e. disable wifi, or disable data)

steps.expected: Verify the sign-in process is completed successfully on 2nd time.
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - Repeat step 1, and at any time, turn off the power of the phone.  Reboot and restart the firefox account sign-in process with the same email address

steps.expected: Verify the user is prompted with password entry.  Verify the user is logged into the firefox accounts after submitting user password.
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) Repeat step 1, by entering e-mail address that is registered with firefox accounts.  Enter password

objects.description:
If user chooses to skip the login to Firefox account, there should be an option to do so

[Prerequisite]
Flash from pvtbuild
objects.name: Skip Sign in to Firefox Account on First Run

steps.expected: FTE is successfully completed
steps.instruction: Follow First-Time Experience user workflow. When it reaches 'Firefox Accounts' page, press next and complete the FTE.

steps.expected: The user is signed in successfully.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings->Firefox accounts, and sign in using existing login for Firefox account

steps.expected: The user created account successfully and signed in.
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - From step 1, go to Settings->Firefox accounts, and create a new account and confirm account

steps.expected: The user is signed in successfully.
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - From step 1, after pressing 'next' on Firefox accounts page, press 'back' and create a new user or sign in using existing account on firefox.

objects.description:
Check new account can be created in Settings app once FTE is completed 

Note: Use http://10minutemail.com/10MinuteMail/index.html to create temporary email address for testing purpose
objects.name: Sign up in Settings

steps.expected:
Verify the account is created successfully, pending verification with 'Done' button active
Verify the screen layout is correct

Terms of service and Privacy Notice texts should match from following URL:

https://github.com/mozilla/legal-docs/tree/master/firefoxcloudservicesToS https://github.com/mozilla/legal-docs/tree/master/firefoxcloudservicesPrivacyNotice

and free from spelling, punctuation and grammatical mistakes 
Verify the user needs to enter password with at least 8 characters long

Verify the user should be at least 13 years old, according to COPPA definition: http://www.coppa.org/coppa.htm

If the user selects birth year that corresponds to the age of under 13, the device should show rejection screen.
steps.instruction:
Enter Settings -> Firefox accounts, click 'Create account or sign in'.  Enter email address, year of birth, and password to create a new account

View Terms of service and Privacy Notice text presented in the email address prompt pageby clicking the link for each of them

steps.expected: The phone displays the message showing the account is now verified, within 5 minutes of verification
steps.instruction: Verify the account by pressing 'Verify' button in the email sent to the account holder's email address

steps.expected:
Verify the message 
'Unable to connect to Firefox

Unable to connect to Firefox Accounts right now.  Check your phone settings and your Internet connection'

is shown.
steps.instruction: During any process in step 1, disable wifi and/or data connection so the phone will not have the connection to internet

steps.expected: Verify the user is logged in successfully
steps.instruction: Repeat step 1, with the credential of already created Firefox account

steps.expected: Verify the account is logged in successfully, pending verification.  Clicking the verify button will set the account to the verified state.
steps.instruction: After step 5, sign in using the credential of unverified account

steps.expected: the 'create account or sign in' button is now active
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - Repeat step 1, then press 'Cancel Account Verification'

steps.expected: Verify the account is logged in successfully, pending verification.
steps.instruction: Click create account button, and use the credential from step 6 to create a new account.

objects.description:
When performing a secure task, re-authentication of firefox account should be initiated

[Prerequisite]
Have Firefox account created and logged in
Have service that can trigger forced authentication (i.e. Marketplace)
objects.name: Force Authentication Scenario

steps.expected: Phone shows the user is logged into the firefox account
steps.instruction: Log in to a verified firefox account on the phone with existing account or a new account

steps.expected: Firefox UI shows up and re-queries the login credential.
steps.instruction:
Trigger re-authentication by 3rd party app through one of the following:
- Disable Find my Device from enabled to disabled
- Purchase an app from Marketplace

steps.expected: A notification of a successful challenge will be provided to the calling application (if required).  The user will remain logged into the Firefox account
steps.instruction: Enter correct UI credential

steps.expected: A notification of a failure will be provided to the calling application (if required)  In the case of a failure during a 3rd party initiated forced auth, the user should not be logged out of Firefox accounts, however the initiating action should not be allowed.
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - From Step 2, enter incorrect UI credential

steps.expected: A notification of a failure will be provided to the calling application (if required)  In the case of a failure during a 3rd party initiated forced auth, the user should not be logged out of Firefox accounts, however the initiating action should not be allowed.
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - From Step 2, enter the credential of the account that is not currently logged in

steps.expected: Firefox UI shows up and re-queries the login credential.
steps.instruction:
(Alternate Flow) - From Step 1, Trigger re-authentication directly by Firefox accounts by:
TBD

steps.expected: A notification of a successful challenge will be provided to the calling application (if required).  The user will remain logged into the Firefox account
steps.instruction: Enter correct UI credential

steps.expected: user should be logged out after a failure
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - From Step 6, enter incorrect UI credential

steps.expected: user should be logged out after a failure
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - From Step 6, enter the credential of the account that is not currently logged in

objects.description:
To check if it will check the SD card storage space first, then check the local storage space.

Prerequisite: 
1. There is corresponding suitable package in OTA/FOTA server. 
2. The check-in URL is directed to proper link. 
3. Prepare one filled SD-card in device (available space is less than update package)
4. Device internal available space is larger than update package
objects.name: SD card is filled while try to download the package

steps.expected: The data connection works well.
steps.instruction: Enable data connection and make sure the data connection works well.

steps.expected: You could find "Check now" button under Software updates.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings->Device Information

steps.expected: Device could perform check-in properly
steps.instruction: Select "Check now" under the Software updates section

steps.expected: You should see one notification "x updates available"
steps.instruction: Pull the notifications page down

steps.expected: You should see the REQUIRED update : "System update xx.xx MB"
steps.instruction: Click the notification "x updates available"
Only select "System update" and uncheck other applications update.

steps.expected: Device should start to download
steps.instruction: Click Download button.

steps.expected: Package could be downloaded, and it will pop up one message with "Later" and "Install" button.
steps.instruction: Wait for the package is downloaded.

steps.expected:
Device should re-start, and enter recover mode to update the device.
(Could see one android robot in recovery mode if it is FOTA update)
steps.instruction: Click Install button to start the update process

steps.expected: After updated, device will reboot and enter system properly.
steps.instruction: Wait for device completes the update

objects.description:
This test verifies the resending of verification email functionality.  This can be tested either from FTU, or Settings -> Firefox accounts

[Prerequisite]
Firefox account is enabled on the device
Knowledge of creating a Firefox account
objects.name: Resend Verification Email

steps.expected: Account is created, awaiting verification
steps.instruction: Create a new account from FTU

steps.expected: Another verification e-mail is sent to the user
steps.instruction: 15 minutes after the account is created, click 'Resend' link in the Firefox Accounts menu item

steps.expected: Verification is completed, and the button to resend the verification email is now disappeared
steps.instruction: Click 'Verify' button in the email

steps.expected: Verify 'Resend Verification Email' button is present
steps.instruction: (Alternate Flow) - From step 1, complete the FTU, and go to settings -> Firefox Accounts

steps.expected: Another verification e-mail is sent to the user
steps.instruction: 15 minutes after the account is created, click 'Resend Verification Email' button in the Firefox Accounts menu item

steps.expected: the link is greyed out, and the verification e-mail won't be sent out.
steps.instruction: Click 'Resend' link again immediately

steps.expected: Another verification e-mail is sent to the user
steps.instruction: Wait until the the link becomes blue, and click it

steps.expected: Verification is completed, and the button to resend the verification email is now disappeared
steps.instruction: Click 'Verify' button in the email that was most recently sent

objects.description:
As a user, I want to tap on a number in call log, and the call is made through network.

Prerequisite: A single SIM device with some call entries in call log (missed, incoming, outgoing) but numbers are not stored in Contacts.
objects.name: [Call log] Call made simplely by tapping on a number in call log, numbers NOT stored in Contacts

steps.instruction: Open "Call log" in "Dialer".
Go to tab "All".

steps.expected:
Call made through, and picked up from that party.
Call page shown with number.
steps.instruction: Tap on a missed call.

steps.expected:
Call made through, and picked up from that party.
Call page shown with number.
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3 for tapping on an incoming call and an outgoing call.
Go to tab "Missed".

steps.expected:
Call made through, and picked up from that party.
Call page shown with number.
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3 for a missed call.

objects.description:
As a user, I want to long tap on a number in call log, and Action menu shown.

Prerequisite: 
(1) A DUAL SIM device with some call entries in call log (missed, incoming, outgoing) but numbers are not stored in Contacts.
(2) 2 SIM cards inserted.
(3) Outgoing calls is set to : SIM1 or SIM 2.

Feature changed since v2.1, behavior is different in v2.0.
objects.name: [Call log] Action menu shown by long tapping on a number in call log, on a DS device

steps.instruction: Open "Call log" in "Dialer".
Go to tab "All".

steps.expected:
"Action menu" shown without the "Call" option.
2 available options are "Send Message" & "Call Information".
steps.instruction: Long tap on a missed call from a contact.

steps.expected:
"Action menu" shown without the "Call" option.
2 available options are "Send Message" & "Call Information".
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3 for long tapping on an incoming call and an outgoing call.
Go to tab "Missed".

steps.expected:
"Action menu" shown without the "Call" option.
2 available options are "Send Message" & "Call Information".
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3 for a missed call.
Repeat step 3~4 for a non contact number.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I want to tap on a number in call log, and the call is made through network.

Prerequisite: 
(1) A DUAL SIM device with some call entries in call log (missed, incoming, outgoing) and numbers are stored in Contacts.
(2) 2 SIM cards inserted.
(3) Outgoing calls is set to : SIM1 or SIM 2.
objects.name: [Call log] Call made simplely by tapping on a number in call log, numbers STORED in Contacts, on a DS device.

steps.instruction: Open "Call log" in "Dialer".
Go to tab "All".

steps.expected: Dialer shown, with correct number, and the Dial button with default SIM label.
steps.instruction:
If Outgoing call is default set to SIM1, Tap on a missed call for SIM2. 
If Outgoing call is default set to SIM2, Tap on a missed call for SIM1.

steps.expected:
Call made through using default SIM set in SIM manager, and can be picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number and "via SIMx" (or picture if any).
steps.instruction: Tap on the green call button.

steps.expected:
Call made through using default SIM set in SIM manager, and can be picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number and "via SIMx" (or picture if any).
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3, 4 for tapping on an incoming call and an outgoing call.
Go to tab "Missed".

steps.expected:
Call made through using default SIM set in SIM manager, and can be picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number and "via SIMx" (or picture if any).
steps.instruction:
If Outgoing call is default set to SIM1, Tap on a missed call for SIM1. 
If Outgoing call is default set to SIM2, Tap on a missed call for SIM2. 
Repeat step 3, 4 for a missed call.

objects.description:
As a user, I want to tap on a number in call log, and the call is made through network.

Prerequisite: 
(1) A DUAL SIM device with some call entries in call log (missed, incoming, outgoing) and numbers are stored in Contacts.
(2) More than 1 number stored for a single contact.
(3) 2 SIM cards inserted.
(4) Outgoing calls is set to : SIM1 or SIM 2.
objects.name: [Call log] Call made simplely by tapping on a number in call log, multiple numbers STORED in Contacts, on a DS device.

steps.expected: Make sure at least 1 number default set to SIM1, and 1 number default set to SIM2.
steps.instruction:
Have a contact with more than 1 number in it. 
Assign SIM for each of them.
Have some entries in call log with number set in Step 1.
Open "Call log" in "Dialer".
Go to tab "All".

steps.expected: Dialer shown, with correct number, and the Dial button with default SIM label.
steps.instruction:
If Outgoing call is default set to SIM1, Tap on a missed call for SIM2. 
If Outgoing call is default set to SIM2, Tap on a missed call for SIM1.

steps.expected:
Call made through using default SIM set in SIM manager, and can be picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number and "via SIMx" (or picture if any).
steps.instruction: Tap on the green call button.

steps.expected:
Call made through using default SIM set in SIM manager, and can be picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number and "via SIMx" (or picture if any).
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3, 4 for tapping on an incoming call and an outgoing call.
Go to tab "Missed".

steps.expected:
Call made through using default SIM set in SIM manager, and can be picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number and "via SIMx" (or picture if any).
steps.instruction:
If Outgoing call is default set to SIM1, Tap on a missed call for SIM1. 
If Outgoing call is default set to SIM2, Tap on a missed call for SIM2. 
Repeat step 3, 4 for a missed call.
